p: In 2018â€“19 influenza season in Japan, both influenza A subtypes (A/H1N1pdm09 and A/H3N2) were widely circulated [ 17]. The scale of the epidemic was the largest since the year 2000, resulting in more than 12 million cases of influenza A virus infection. In contrast, the influenza B epidemic was very small, and mostly involved the Victoria lineage. Thus, influenza B cases were excluded from our analysis.
